body.p: Tuples are used to store collections of items, similar to lists, but with the key difference that tuples are immutable. Once created, the elements of a tuple cannot be changed.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: # Example of tuples my_tuple = (1, 2, 3, "apple", "banana") print(my_tuple[0]) # Output: 1 print(my_tuple[-1]) # Output: banana
